text: The 1978 UCI Track Cycling World Championships were the World Championship for track cycling. They took place in Munich, West Germany in 1978.World Championship Track Cycling 2014-1893 Twelve events were contested, 10 for men (3 for professionals, 7 for amateurs) and 2 for women. ==Medal summary== {| |- bgcolor="#cccccc" | colspan=7 | Men's Professional Events |- |Men's sprint | Kōichi Nakano || Dieter Berkmann || Yoshi Sugata |- | |Gregor Braun || Roy Schuiten || Jean-Luc Vandenbroucke |- |Men's motor-paced | Wilfried Peffgen || Martin Venix || Cees Stam |- bgcolor="#cccccc" | colspan=7 | Men's Amateur Events |- | |Lothar Thoms || Jocelyn Lovell || Rainer Hönisch |- |Men's sprint | Anton Tkáč ||Emanuel Raasch || Christian Drescher |- | |Detlef Macha || Norbert Dürpisch || Uwe Unterwalder |- |Men's team pursuit | Uwe Unterwalder Gerald Mortag Matthias Wiegand Volker Winkler || Vladimir Osokin Vassili Ehrlich Vitali Petrakov Igor Pilipenko || Robert Dill-Bundi Urs Freuler Hans Kaenel Walter Baumgartner |- |Men's points race |Noël Dejonckheere || Walter Baumgartner || Jean-Jacques Rebiere |- |Men's motor-paced | Rainer Podlesch || Mattheus Pronk ||Martin Rietveld |- |Men's tandem | Vladimir Vackar Miloslav Vymazal|| Gerald Ash Leslie Darcewski || Sjaak Pieters Laurens Veldt |- bgcolor="#cccccc" | colspan=7 | Women's Events |- |Women's sprint |Galina Tsareva |Sue Novara |Iva Zajikova |- |Women's individual pursuit |Keetie van Oosten-Hage |Anna Riemersma |Luigina Bissoli |} ==Medal table== ==See also== * 1978 UCI Road World Championships ==References== Uci Track Cycling World Championships, 1978 Track cycling Category:UCI Track Cycling World Championships by year Category:International sports competitions hosted by West Germany
title: 1978 UCI Track Cycling World Championships
